facilities.title: Bridgeport Stone
facilities.subTitle: Bridgeport, Texas
facilities.description:
The Bridgeport Stone facility, located approximately 60 miles from the Dallas-Fort Worth metro area, furnishes a wide array of products to the construction market-place.

The limestone is light to medium gray with some tan limestone. It is truck and rail served with a high capacity plant, which produces a full range of products from 36 inch riprap to manufactured sand. 

The Quarry is listed on the TXDOT quality aggregate list.

facilities.name: Davis Quarry
facilities.subTitle: Davis, Oklahoma
facilities.description:
The Davis Quarry produces a light-medium gray limestone. The quarry furnishes a full spectrum of washed coarse aggregates (from 3” to 3/8” products), multiple base products (3”to 1” crusher run and ODOT varieties), riprap products, asphalt screenings and manufactured sand. In addition, the Davis Quarry has a pug mill plant, which can mix up to minus 3” bases and engineer moisture content to customer’s needs.

The bulk specific gravity of Davis coarse aggregate is 2.66 with absorption of 0.7%. MMM - Davis is listed on the quality aggregate lists of OK and KS DOT and is routinely used in concrete and bituminous applications without restriction.

facilities.name: Snyder Quarry
facilities.title: Snyder Quarry
facilities.subTitle: Located 5.5 miles west of Snyder, Oklahoma on Hwy 62B
facilities.description:
The Snyder Quarry is located 5.5 miles west of Snyder, OK on Hwy 62B and produces brownish red and dark gray granite, which can be considered the hardest, and most durable crushed granite on the OK, KS and TX DOT qualified source lists. The Quarry is rail served by BNSF and produces a full spectrum of sizes from riprap and rock filter dam products to microsurfacing/slurry seal screenings and manufactured sand.

The Bulk specific gravity is 2.60 with absorption of 0.4%.
